Package eu.opends.analyzer

Class DrivingTaskLogger

java.lang.Object
eu.opends.analyzer.DrivingTaskLogger
public class DrivingTaskLogger
extends java.lang.Object
This class is used for logging driving task data to a text file.
Author:
Rafael Math

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    DrivingTaskLogger​(java.lang.String outputFolder, java.lang.String driverName, java.lang.String drivingTask)
    Creates a new driving task logger and initializes it.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void quit()
    Closes the file when the simulator has been halted.
    void reportPresentationType​(int currentPresentationType)
    Adds changes of the HMI screen to the output file.
    void reportReactionTime​(java.lang.String triggerName, java.util.Calendar startTime)
    Adds a reaction time measurement to the output file.
    void reportSpeedDifference​(float averageDifference, float standardDeviation)
    Adds values for mean (arithmetic average) and standard deviation of speed to the log file.
    void reportSpeedLimitExceeded()
    Adds speed limit exceeding to the log file.
    void reportSpeedLimitUnderExceeded()
    Adds a note to the log file, if the car is getting too slow.
    void reportSpeedNormal()
    Adds a note to the log file, if the car drives at normal speed again.
    void reportText​(java.lang.String string)
    Adds a string to the output file.
    void reportText​(java.lang.String string, java.util.Date timestamp)
    Adds a string with time stamp to the output file.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • DrivingTaskLogger

      public DrivingTaskLogger​(java.lang.String outputFolder, java.lang.String driverName, java.lang.String drivingTask)
      Creates a new driving task logger and initializes it. A file with the given parameters driver name, driving task file name and type of progress bar will be written.
      Parameters:
      outputFolder - Indicates the folder the log file will be written to.
      driverName - Name of the current driver.
      drivingTask - Name of the driving task file.

  • Method Details

    • reportText

      public void reportText​(java.lang.String string, java.util.Date timestamp)
      Adds a string with time stamp to the output file.
      Parameters:
      string - String to add.
      timestamp - Time stamp for output line.

    • reportText

      public void reportText​(java.lang.String string)
      Adds a string to the output file.
      Parameters:
      string - String to add.

    • reportReactionTime

      public void reportReactionTime​(java.lang.String triggerName, java.util.Calendar startTime)
      Adds a reaction time measurement to the output file.
      Parameters:
      triggerName - Name of the trigger causing the reaction measurement.
      startTime - Start time of the measurement.

    • reportPresentationType

      public void reportPresentationType​(int currentPresentationType)
      Adds changes of the HMI screen to the output file.
      Parameters:
      currentPresentationType - Presentation type of the current presentation task to be added to the log file.

    • reportSpeedLimitExceeded

      public void reportSpeedLimitExceeded()
      Adds speed limit exceeding to the log file.

    • reportSpeedLimitUnderExceeded

      public void reportSpeedLimitUnderExceeded()
      Adds a note to the log file, if the car is getting too slow.

    • reportSpeedNormal

      public void reportSpeedNormal()
      Adds a note to the log file, if the car drives at normal speed again.

    • reportSpeedDifference

      public void reportSpeedDifference​(float averageDifference, float standardDeviation)
      Adds values for mean (arithmetic average) and standard deviation of speed to the log file.
      Parameters:
      averageDifference - Average speed deviation (positive, if car faster than allowed; negative, if car slower than allowed).
      standardDeviation - Standard deviation of speed.

    • quit

      public void quit()
      Closes the file when the simulator has been halted.
